segments.title: Explaining Density Concept
segments.summary: Explains density as the ratio of mass to volume, measured in kg/m³. Describes density as how crowded or packed something is, using examples like water having 1000 kg/m³ density.

segments.title: Density Examples Comparison
segments.summary: Compares densities of different materials, with water at 1 g/cm³ and iron at 7.8 g/cm³. Explains how density remains uniform within same materials regardless of size.

segments.title: Air Density Variation
segments.summary: Discusses how air density varies with altitude, from 0.1 g/cm³ at surface to 0.004 g/cm³ at 10km altitude. Explains why density decreases with height due to atmospheric pressure.

segments.title: Water Density Temperature Relationship
segments.summary: Explains how water's density changes with temperature, reaching maximum density at 4°C. Details how cooling affects molecular arrangement and density.

segments.title: Density and Flotation
segments.summary: Demonstrates how density determines whether objects float or sink in fluids. Objects with lower density than the fluid float, while those with higher density sink.
